author: Virago750
title: An exemplary standard of care, given current pressures
body:
My elderly uncle has a number of extremely complex medical conditions. We had to call an ambulance for him on two separate occasions over Christmas and New Year.  
The ambulance crews were extremely caring and thorough. They took time to consider his history, ailments, medication etc. of which there are many! He was taken to Antrim Area Hospital, straight into resuscitation. I was then able to stay with him for most of next couple of days. In terms of the ED, the care and compassion provided by ED Consultant Emer to both me and him was outstanding. He was then moved to Ward B2 where he continued to receive the same wonderful standard of care from nursing staff, pharmacy, podiatry, wound care etc. Despite one extremely challenging patient subjecting them to continuous harassment and abuse. On a number of occasions the other patient hurled items at them; truly appalling to watch.It is staggering that that HSC staff continue to give such an exemplary standard of care, given all the pressures that they are under.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Belfast93
title: Outstanding Care & Service In Wing A
body:
Last week I attended a follow up appointment with my mum after a breast cancer diagnosis in Wing A outpatients Dept in BCH.  
The department was extremely busy, I observed the staff checking on all the patients waiting individually, which I thought was amazing given they were run of their feet.  
My mum was extremely nervous about the appointment, and she had mentioned after she felt so at ease with the staff in the department.  
After being called to one of the clinical rooms, her mind was put at ease throughout the appointment by the Nurse Specialist Clare, everything was explained in terms she could understand.  
She left the appointment feeling more confident she knew what was going on, she answered all the concerns and informed her off all the support available to help her during any treatment.  
These staff were outstanding, and I could not give them enough credit for the compassion and professionalism shown.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Liam54
title: Taking DKA and Diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes
body:
I unexpectedly took a DKA and had to be admitted to Crosshouse Hospital for 4 days to get me back to working order. The nurses were AMAZING. They were so friendly, humorous, attentive, compassionate and caring. They were also overworked and understaffed to an extent that blew my mind how they managed to keep going, but they did.  
Since I have been discharged I have been in contact with the Diabetic Centre in the Lister Building. The specialists and consultants there have been beyond friendly. The have made this big life change seem doable and have made me feel safe enough there to talk about not just my diabetes but related mental health. I cannot praise the Diabetic team enough, nor thank them enough. I look forward to continue working with them.

author: deploymenthm55
title: I was lying there for 17 hours
body:
On a Tuesday in December, I left a restaurant, slipped in the car park, fell backwards, and hit my head.  
My friends took me to Arbroath Minor Injuries Unit and arrived there at 1:45pm and was assessed by nurses who immobilised my head with strapping and was put on a hospital trolley. I was at Arbroath for 10 and a half hours. I was attended to the whole time by 3 nurses who were continuously phoning the ambulance to take me to Ninewells Hospital. They were told that the ambulance had been dispatched 3 times, but the ambulances had been redirected to other casualties.  
The 3 nurses taking care of me, Jen, Sarah, and Debbie continuously contacted Ninewells and Kings Cross Hospital to let them know the ambulance had not arrived and that I was considered an emergency. This went on for a while. During this time, I told the nurses that I was in a considerable amount of lower back pain because of how long I had been lying on the trolley. Jen contacted the consultant at Ninewells to check whether I could be moved. The consultant agreed I could be moved to a 45-degree angle to help alleviate the pain and this did make my back pain feel better.  
Arbroath closed at 8:00pm and the nurses kept calling Ninewells and Kings Cross (where their managers were) to let them know. The management team there agreed to send two palliative care nurses over from Dundee to replace the nurses who had been looking after me as their shift was due to end.  
It had passed the closing point of 8:00pm and at about 10:00pm there was a call to say that an ambulance was 21 minutes away. It got to midnight and the two palliative care nurses had not arrived and the 3 nurses looking after me had stopped on their shift an additional 4 hours.  
At 12:20am, the two palliative care nurses had arrived with the ambulance. The ambulance staff told me that a spare ambulance had been taken out of service. And I think the Kings Cross management team had left it too late to make a decision about replacing the nurses. At 12:40am we set off to Dundee.  
We arrived at Dundee, and I was physically sick - concussion had started when I was moved from the ambulance at Ninewells. I was then taken to resus to get help from them because I was still immobilised from being strapped up. After this, I then entered a queue for A&E and eventually I had my blood pressure checked.  
I was admitted to Ninewells A&E at 1:45am and after being checked over by a nurse, I wasn’t seen until 8:45am when I was sent for a brain scan and told everything was ok. I was discharged about 2 hours after this. The consultants at Ninewells were all aware that I was coming as per numerous telephone calls from Jen, Sarah, and Debbie. So why did it take 7 hours to attend me?  
What I would like to say next is that the 3 nurses at Arbroath went above and beyond the call of duty and couldn’t do anymore for me -they were fantastic and continuously phoned consultants, managers, and the ambulance. They should be recognised for their work because what happened wasn’t fair on them and wasn’t far on me.  
I was lying there for 17 hours in total waiting to be seen-this was an emergency and I don’t understand how it took so long. This was a very difficult experience, and I don’t want this to happen to anyone again.

readBy.name: Angus Health and Social Care Partnership

author: sambatk77
title: Advocacy provided at short notice
body: My advocate is Peter. He has been supporting me whilst I am in hospital. He has been great. Always punctual and helpful. Nothing is too much trouble. He came today at very short notice.

author: David12
title: Car parking problems
body:
I entered Pinderfields hospital car park and the machine issued me with a ticket. On leaving within the 2 hour period both payment machines stated the ticket was faulty, I being let out of the car park by hospital security. I do hope I am not issued with a fine as the car parking company are in breach of contract by not ensuring I was issued with a ticket that is not faulty.  
I will be using the local bus service from now on. I am not best pleased

author: centaurusfh69
title: The care was first class
body:
I wan to offer highest praise for both North Devon District Hospital and SWAS.  
In December I was was suffering from emphysema ( a pre-existing condition) – an ambulance was called and arrived in 10 minutes and I was taken to North Devon District Hospital. I admit I had to wait for a while in A&E but the nurses in A&E were fabulous as were the ambulance staff. They even sorted me out with something to eat whilst I waited.  
The care whilst on the ward was also first class and I feel the staff went above and beyond to help me and make me feel comfortable.

readBy.name: South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust
Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: magpiedw73
title: The staff did their best
body:
I fell at work after being knocked over. Just before Christmas. I was taken after waiting half an hour for the ambulance, to Raigmore Hospital A&E. Fortunately, as I was to discover, there was a space for me immediately in the department. I was treated in a timely and courteous manner by the staff. I could see they were very busy. My husband was able to come in, which helped. I was then x-rayed, processed and sent to a Trauma & Orthapeadic ward, when it was discovered that I had broken my femur.  
There I had to wait until the following day for my operation to fix my hip. I was in a ward that mostly had elderly people in, in various stages of trauma or recovery, the longest of which had been there for 4 months waiting to get home (they did just before Christmas).  
I happily got my operation and was returned to the ward. During my few days on this ward I heard stories from patients about their journey through their trauma. One had not been discovered for about 10 hours in a sheltered housing complex. One had to wait 3 hours in an ambulance outside Raigmore. And another kept being told today was the day they would get their op after breaking her hip, but it took over 3 days.  
There was quite a few different members of staff when I was on this ward. They were on 12-hour shifts and they were understaffed at times due to staff phoning in sick. Throughout the time the ward was very noisy, but I was treated well, even though the staff did not have a lot of time to speak with the patients. Sometimes I found myself ringing my bell for others who could not, listening to them and in turn they were listening to me.  
Staff did their best. After a couple of days I was transferred to a quieter ward in Gynae, where I was able to sleep better. I met more patients who had other stories to tell. Yet again there was a shortage of staff. I don't know if the staff in both wards were aware, but their conversations which they had with each other about themselves, other staff members or patients were able to be heard by all as they did not lower their voices, and it also contributed to the noise on occasion. Especially at night. But also I learned quite a lot!  
The food in Raigmore Hospital, to put it bluntly, was not very good. The ordering system did not seem to work very well and staff were struggling to get reception with their Ipad at times. There must be a better way. The quality of food was mostly poor, considering that people need good nutrition to get better, it was disappointing. Though I daresay this is to do with financial considerations. Quite a few people were vegetarian and kept getting asked about meat options. Would have thought there would be a better system for all. The staff did their best.  
I observed that the staff did not always have the time or opportunity to pass on messages and patients would be asked the same question on a couple of occasions. I observed that staff sometimes spent time searching for misplaced items of equipment or charts because they were not put back in the appropriate places. Due to staff being distracted with an event or emergency. The staff did their best.  
As it was Christmas I do not know if it was any different from normal. They talked about changes in the new year and staff leaving. Staff did not seem settled and they seemed concerned. I was visited a few days after my op. Due to public holiday and busyness, I was given information which I maybe should have got the day after my op. I did get physiotherapy the day after my op, which was good.  
I got home after the OT and physio signed me off. I received all the equipment I needed and medication for home. I was told I would be sent my discharge letter in the post, as they were busy at the time, and I was off!

author: january23
title: Disappointed with our treatment.
body:
Last year, my partner and I attended the EPAC, Ninewells where we learned we were miscarrying.  
At the appointment the midwife was very quiet and after about a minute reassured us that the first minute is always 'quiet'. She then told us there was no longer a heartbeat. Another midwife was called as the first midwife was unable to confirm that we were miscarrying. A few minutes later the second midwife arrived and performed the scan, with another midwife being called who shook her head and said I am sorry. We were advised a sonographer needed to also be called to confirm the miscarriage.  
Whilst waiting for the sonographer the first midwife asked if we knew what was happening? My partner and I were fearing the worst and were certain we were miscarrying however were both very disappointed at how the midwives communicated with us at our appointment. It felt very dismissive of our emotions and as if we should have known what they were talking about. It wasn't until around 30 minutes after the appointment started that the second midwife said she was 99% sure that our pregnancy would not be continuing, however we would need to re-attend for a confirmation scan.  
We attended for the confirmation scan where we were told the pregnancy was not continuing and we were miscarrying. However, on arrival the unit was not set up properly and parts of the scanning equipment were missing and it was very unorganised. I appreciate there are a number of patients who will attend the department, however the midwife didn't appear to remember much about us and given how distressing the appointment was going to be we were again disappointed at the treatment.

author: Jolex93
title: Registering a pregnancy
body:
It seems absolutely impossible to register a pregnancy in Teesside. The midwife has cancelled four appointments. They appear totally uninterested which is very concerning. 12 weeks pregnant and can not access basic antenatal care.  
It's almost like if they ignore you ,you will go away.

readBy.name: NORTH TEES AND HARTLEPOOL NHS FOUNDATION TRUST

author: swinggy48
title: Positive care experience.
body:
I was admitted to Ward 32 at the RAH for a laparoscopy in December. I would like to take an opportunity to highlight the exceptional care and attention I experienced throughout. From the pre assessment nurses A/N Halbert and Leslie, the anaesthetic nurse Susan, my recovery nurse Angela and the wonderful ward team Sam, Louise, Karen, Claire and S/N Ashleigh.  
Despite the pressures faced the dedicated team are a shining example of compassion and person-centred care.

title: wonderful, efficient, courteous and very helpful…
body:
I was there for a few hours for my double appointments with
Surgery and dealings with the receptionist team.
I am not able to give you a feeling of how Happy I felt for the extreme help I received from the Nurse on Duty who cared for   
for me very professionally and took account of every detail of my problems. I can only say Thank you "" God Bless ""
and wish you the very best.
same also goes to the two receptionists on duty who helped
not only to  confirm my appointments, but did this with Grace and humility I did not catch the names correctly but you can see the same on the Rota and my appointments on the day.
which was today.

Kindly thank them all very much on my behalf, I know I can trust the great service given to me and many others visiting your Surgery.

With Kind Regards, have a great and Happy "" New Year""
Keep up the nice and efficient work as always.

Thanks a million.

title: Great practice
body: I would like to thank all the wonderful staff for looking after my son Simon Cartwright. Your skills patience and kindness are immeasurable.  Once again many heartfelt thanks. Happy new year to you all

title: Dispensary really helpful
body: Staff went out of their way to assist with a medication issue. I emailed and it was sorted on the same day which was greatly appreciated.

author: xraymr39
title: I couldn't have asked for a better service
body:
My 7-week-old baby boy had been unwell for a number of days, starting with a blocked nose that developed into a cough, along with vomiting. He then began to really struggle with his breathing and I took him to see my GP. His sats (oxygen) were lower than normal, and she agreed that he was struggling to breathe and rang through to Musgrove. They said for us to go straight to the PAU.  
On arriving at the PAU, we were seen straight away and my little boy was assessed. Luckily his sats were much better than with the GP, but he was still finding it hard to breathe, hadn't fed much or had a wet nappy that day. We were taken to a small private room and waited for the paediatrics doctor to see us. She was really thorough finding out what he had been like the days prior. She explained that it was likely to be bronchiolitis but we would need to wait for the swab result to be sure.  
She assessed him again and as his sats were okay she said that we would need to stay and be monitored but hopefully wouldn't need to be admitted. 5 hours later, we were allowed to go home, but the doctor explained what we needed to look for in terms of his condition getting worse. We were given a direct number to the PAU and a 48-hour window to use it if we were worried that his condition had deteriorated.  
Once home, his condition gradually improved and we didn't need to ring the number, but it was really reassuring to have it.  
The staff that saw us were brilliant and I couldn't have asked for a better service. Thank you.

author: Nbro22
title: Ayrshire Fertility Unit
body:
Going to the Ayrshire Fertility Unit for the first time was something that can understandably be quite nerve wracking. After meeting the lovely ladies there, that dissipated. They are so patient, understanding and quite literally hold your hand throughout.  
The treatment might not have been successful for us, but I’m so glad we had the team that we did supporting us throughout.

readBy.name: Office of Ruth Maguire ( Mp for Cunninghame South )

title: Fantastic care and amazing consultant !
body: I came in to ward 3b after having my knee replaced and can not fault the care and treatment I received . Nothing was too much trouble ! From being booked in to the fantastic anaesthetist , my brilliant surgeon and all the threatre staff who were amazing to all the nurses and staff on the ward I could not fault anyone ! They are all working so hard and doing an amazing job and I want to thank you for making a tough time a lot easier xx

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

author: Clarineo
title: Faultless service
body: I was seen in A&E within an hour on a busy Friday evening and was impressed with the nurses and doctors, especially Professor Ferguson and Orthopaedic Doctor MacDonald. They set my wrist and I was discharged in about two hours. I cannot fault their care and service, thank you.

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Great practice
body:
This practice is brilliant , receptionists are really helpful . Always managed to get an appointment in a timely manner & the practitioners are very professional. 
Thanks

title: Poor back-office services
body:
Supposed to have a check-up appointment every six months. It's now more than two months overdue. Rang appointments twice. on each occasion told I was on the list and would be contacted shortly. Second time the lady said I should contact the consultants' secretary. Rang the number every day, several times a day, for a week - always got recorded message. 
Also, there used to be a monthly clinic in our local hospital. This stopped and has never restarted. Attending Derriford costs me c£25; on a pension that's a not inconsiderable expense. Why has the local clinic been reinstated?

title: Shocking Treatment from Staff on Ward 29
body:
My fathers, a World War 2 -  war veteran, stay on Ward 29 was nothing by shambolic from start to finish. They did not investigate his illness and instead discharged him, still with the illness and without getting to the route cause or investigation carried out, only to be readmitted with the same thing 2 days later after still suffering with the same illness at home the following day. He caught Covid on this ward also and was not tested before he was discharged even though he developed symptoms whilst on the ward. I understand if new symptoms occur, then they should be tested prior to discharge. 

The Doctor did not listen to our concerns or carry out a requested scan which would have flagged up internal bleeds and infection on lung. His response to not carrying one out is that it would not benefit the hospital!!!!! What about being of benefit to the patient!!!!! My father ended up on the floor at home having vomited copious amount of blood and faecal matter and was still had bladder retention which the ward and did not investigate.. 

The discharge nurse only called once they had kicked him out of the ward to say he was on his way home... Communication was appalling... Hasten to say, on Re-admission to the Leicester royal infirmay, blue lighted and straight into Resus, we as a family demanded he not be returned to this Ward as Resus obviously informed he would need to be admitted to a Medical Ward, 29 being one of them... 

I will be raising this through Patient information line

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Mri excellent
body: Excellent service from Healthshare. My 2nd mri here. Excellent care beforehand with appointments and information. Treated kindly and with respect during scans. 1st class environment. Would totally recommend.

title: Improving Practice
body: After long waits for help in the last 2 years I feel after last 2 visits we are turning a corner and have noticed that my appointments have been timely and efficient

author: Taksa
title: Excellent dental service
body:
I can never be grateful enough for the amazing doctor Christine who has been looking after my child's teeth for several years now. She is always very attentive, empathic, professional and patient. Her assistant Valerie is also incredible. They always explain what is going to happen, talk to the child and show her the tools and how everything is done.  
Today my child had 2 tooth fillings, and she was terribly scared. Christine and Valerie supported her, were very kind and very present there for the child, did their job very neatly and talked through what they were doing and gave my child a lot of reassurance.  
I'm very happy and lucky to have them as our child's dentist specialists.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Endoscopy Dept: friendly and efficient
body: My experience of the endoscopy department was positive. I was warmly greeted and well informed of what would happen during the appointment by the desk administrator. All of the medical staff that were involved with my endoscopy were friendly and made sure I was comfortable and well looked after. This department is a credit to the hospital. Thank you for your care.

title: Excellent service
body:
The staff were friendly and jolly , feeling anxious as I was having a complex cataract procedure I was put at ease right away .
The procedure was done promptly and with friendly and professional staff . I am exceedingly happy with the service and hope to see them all again soon for my other cataract hopefully.

title: Fantastic treatment
body: I had surgery for a broken toe in November, this resulted in three subsequent appointments at the Fracture clinic, twice to have my toe redressed and inspected for infection due to the wound sustained to my toe and a third on 15 December to have the wire removed from my toe and to mobilise me.  Every appointment has been either on time or I’ve been seen before my scheduled time, the nurses have been absolutely lovely and very gentle and caring.  My third appointment was firstly with a doctor who removed the wire, I was dreading the procedure expected some pain but I had absolutely none!  Then I had three X-rays and finally a consultation with another doctor who showed me before and after photos of my badly broken toe, he gave me lots of good advice on aftercare, showering, driving etc and said he’d call me in four weeks time.  How can I ask for more than that!  As a human race we are all very quick to complain but not quick enough to compliment.  I honestly couldn’t have received better care both at the Fracture Clinic and when I was being admitted for surgery!  At the end of every appointment I was told to go to see a receptionist to book another appointment, they too were fantastic.  Everyone has been absolutely outstanding and I’d like my thanks recorded and fed back to them please. Thank you all so much, Sue

title: Outstanding Appointment
body: Ref. Appointments with Dr Jason. Initial appointment was a phone consultation where I felt my needs were listened to and met.  I then had a face to face follow up and was treated with utmost respect, listened to, he was current in his understanding and understood my condition. It would be great to see Dr Jason stay at this practice.  If felt like care I would receive from our family Dr in my younger days.  I absolutely appreciate the level of care I have received.  Thank you

title: Why didn't I try this earlier??
body: I was always reluctant to try therapy thinking my problems "are not that bad", but CBT has helped me see things in a different perspective and process some of my trauma and how that affects my daily life and interactions, I also had a lovely therapist and I thank her for the patience she had with me and the tools she gave me to move forward, you know who you are! Thank you to Sutton Uplift and the great work you do, I was at the deep end. ever grateful, Élia.

readBy.name: South West London and St George's Mental Health NHS Trust

title: Ward 8
body: Just want to say a massive thank you to everybody who cared for me on this ward and to the surgeon and Anaesthetist who went above and beyond to ensure I was cared for at the best. Their care was extremely personal and outstanding, I arrived for surgery very distressed and they ensured I was comfortable and calm. Couldn’t of wished for anything better

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

title: Wonderful staff at A &E
body:
From the receptionist to my final Dr, I was treated with care and compassion. 
Admittedly I was  “real” heart emergency case so may have got fast tracked, but I felt looked after and really thoroughly examined. 
I hope my comments will get passed on to the staff - it was mid day on Tuesday  3 January.

title: Ward j3
body:
Myself and family have not been a fan of Crumpsall hospital. When my aunt got admitted we were adamant for her to be taken to any other hospital. 
She moved to many wards in the hospital and they were all the same. 
Her final ward where she got discharged from was j3 b.18
Most of the nursing staff would come in do what they needed, with minimal communication with my aunt and leave. It’s like the nurses within the hospital don’t want to be at work. This was witnessed on all wards. 
There was one nurse on j3 and this nurse alone was incredible. She would attend to my aunt regularly, explain everything to the small bits of what exact medication she was taking and what they are for. Her joy and happiness was lovely, I could tell that she adores her job and loved being at work,  Despite her role being very challenging. Her festive uniform and Christmas  pens were great as my aunt was alone isolated, seeing someone cheery and happy was great for her. Till today she always praises the care given.
All nurses are overworked but as this nurse said 
 She doesn’t see coming to work as a job rather a hobby as it’s something she loved and was really passionate about.
Nhs Needs more staff like her. I do hope her manager or any higher authority staff recognise her for the work she does.

title: Great staff
body: I was diagnosed a bladder cancer and in 3 weeks got surgery, urology staff is a fantastic team, I want mention the staff of Recovery Unit for all help they gave me, last to mention as well is the staff of Princess Anne ward, I conclude with a enormous thank you to all.

readBy.name: Mid and South Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Caring staff
body: Despite spending 53 hours in ED waiting for a bed before moving to MAU Thrushel, I cannot fault the incredible care from the staff. Derriford are under unbelievable strain through no fault of their own. ED was so busy they almost broke their record for the busiest ever shift! Even though they were busy it did not stop the staff from the care and attention they gave. Once I moved to Thrushel the fantastic care continued especially 3 lovely staff who went above and beyond the care I received. Our government needs to treat NHS staff with the outstanding appreciation they truly deserves!

title: Great team & practice
body:
Been with this surgery for over ten years and about time I left a review.
Receptionists have always been very helpful & welcoming.
Doctors & Nurses always a warm welcome when entering the room and pleasingly they care.

title: Efficient service
body: Booked an X-ray this morning online, for an early afternoon X-ray. Arrived early and was X-rayed early. I didn’t even have to pay for the parking as wasn’t at the hospital for long. Great nhs service, thank you X-ray dept

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Caring staff
body: I had  some  issues which where concerning to me. Had a quick response  from the medical team had  a appointment  the next  day Ifeel ihave had the best  treatment possible  under to days  demands of our  nhs.

title: Glad I've moved to this surgery
body: Whilst it is early days (I only moved in the Autumn from Park Surgery) I've had two appointments and for both the doctor appeared in the waiting room before the appointment time calling me in! Very impressive, friendly and efficient.  Obviously time will tell whether I've made the right decision but so far so good.

title: Ambulance/doctors
body: Everyone in major’s department worked as a team together at such a busy time, a big thank you to the two ambulances lady’s and man that worked in majors you all was amazing and so kind and helpful! Every single doctor, ambulance worker , porter was brilliant!!

title: Wonderful service
body:
Despite the hospital being under obvious pressure, the service I received when I had to attend the Urgent Care Centre on New Year’s Day was first class. The receptionist in A & E was warm and welcoming, the triage nurse carried out a thorough initial assessment very soon after I arrived, and the doctor I saw was very empathetic and gave me a lot of really useful information to help me manage my symptoms - as well as a much needed dose of antibiotics! 

Please pass on my thanks to your staff for the amazing job they are doing and the wonderful service they provide, in what are obviously very challenging circumstances.

author: JM22
title: Minor Injuries, OOH, Paeds
body:
My baby boy became unwell on Christmas Eve. I was navigated to the Minor Injury and Illness unit in Arbroath. He was assessed by highly skilled nurses and given appropriate treatment. I was advised of “red flags” and left feeling well supported and ready for any possible deterioration. The team couldn’t have done a better job at calming an extremely irrational new Mum!  
The next morning I noticed some of the red flags that had been mentioned and after calling, was navigated to the OOH team at Kingscross. I was very impressed at the knowledge held by the call handler and again was advised to attend urgently for assessment. I was greeted by the call handler and shown straight to the doctors room.  
Doctor H was fantastic. He listened to my concerns and spent a significant amount of time gaining an extensive history before checking my baby over. We were then sent to Paeds in Ninewells. Thankfully after several hours in the dept we were sent home with a direct phone number for the Unit and again equipped with all the relevant information needed to deal with any eventuality.

readBy.name: Angus Health and Social Care Partnership

title: No Kindness or Compassion
body: A big thanks to the staff member who would not let my autistic son in on Monday night to try and get warm after breaking down on his journey home a long, long way from home. He only had to wait almost 6 hours in the cold until 3am before the rac arrived. So, once again a massive thanks for the kindness and compassion you showed, you did our nhs proud!

title: Amazing service
body:
I just wanted to email to say how grateful I am for the help I received just before Christmas.

I was in desperate need of a prescription, it was late in the day, nearly to close of play for Christmas and im sure there was no way my ask was covered by 'normal service'.

Thank you so very much for your help, I know how busy you all are - but what you did for me to get that prescription at short notice made all the difference. The pain and discomfort I didnt have to endure over Xmas made such a big personal difference to me.

I know you all get a hard time at some point in your work for the public - but please know everything you do is really appreciated.

Thanks again

title: Amazing caring staff member
body: I attended with my daughter and we were both quite ill. We were called to triage and despite it being really busy and the staff under huge strain the staff member was amazing! I could have cried with how they helped us out. Quick, efficient and extremely understanding. Thank you so so so much!

title: Thank you
body: I would just like to thank the staff at Ford medical from the receptionist - nurses - and doctors you have done your self proud in these bad times it’s very hard with what is going on and the back lash you guys get I have been looked after very well with things going on and would just like to say thank you and I hope you start to get the extra help you guys need . And the manager should congratulate your receptionist for such good manners

title: A fantastic surgery all around
body:
I have been a patient at the surgery for a number of years and they have always been fantastic! From the GPs themselves, the nurses and the reception staff! No matter what myself and my family have needed, medical or administrative, they have always be willing to go above to support.
I read so many story's about people who can't get in to see a GP or can't contact them but at Garswood it's straight forward and simple

title: Amazing practice
body: I've been with this surgery for almost 3 years now, and i can say i have never had a bad experience. Maybe a few neutral ones, but definitely nothing that can outweigh all the excellent ones. During these 3 years, they've been efficient, caring, and very thorough, even when i myself forget about follow ups, and I've seen them for quite a few different issues. The staff is always nice and cheerful. Thank you

title: Great practice
body: Had cause to visit the Nightingale recently over a three week period. The care and attention I received was faultless and delivered with great sensitivity. Thank you.

title: Amazing and genuinely caring staff
body: I came in late on New Year’s Eve being transferred from the out of hours doctor to get further tests done, I was very anxious and I arrived sobbing to 2 nurses, who were absolutely brilliant and calmed me down and got me seen quickly. One particular nurse made me feel at ease, she was so lovely and checked on me the whole time I was there, when I was being seen by other doctors and nurses. Luckily what I went in for wasn’t anything serious, but even though I felt silly getting upset, they were all so reassuring and genuinely cared for me. Anyone feeling scared about going to a&e/urgent treatment centre, shouldn’t be, as you’ll be in good hands.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great service amongst an nhs crisis
body: My son had a  allergic reaction to something and I had to take him to Children's a&e. I really cannot fault the service received. Everyone from the receptionist, to the nurses, cleaners and doctors were extremely helpful and always friendly. They made sure my little one had toys to play with in our cubicle, they made sure he got a snack after a long waiting period, offered me something to drink and were very helpful and friendly whenever I saw someone or had questions. I was so grateful to the staff from yesterday.

title: Great helpful practice
body: Always helpful seen when needed, doctors call back very good, repeates prescription on time when ordered, generally very lucky to have such Sergey

title: My stay from A & E to Edmund Stone and  Eastwood…
body: I was suffering from postural hypertension. I cannot praise the whole hospital enough. These doctors nuses and auxiliaries are under so much pressure. I was at 1st in the ambulance handover hub.  Then admitted to A & E   I was then looked after by wards Edmund Stone and Eastwood Ward  Considering how busy these people are they gave me the best treatment during my stay and they deserve every penny of a payrise. I cannot thank you all enough for all your kindness and hard work for getting me better. Please support your local hospital it is an amazing hospital with amazing staff

readBy.name: Mid and South Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Professional and caring team
body: Thank you for the care the whole medical and nursing team in A&E, including the Porters and Domestic and ancillary staff, gave to my elderly mother following her fall at home. You were all very professional and caring and we felt confident Mum was in, and will continue to be, safe hands.  Thank you.

title: Wonderful Practice
body: I've been a patient for more than 3 years. I have always found the service top notch. Always received professional and courteous treatment. I would recommend to anyone.

author: bargainet83
title: Lack of support from X-ray staff
body:
My partner has Parkinson's. He broke his hip, the operation was went well. Currently all medication and food is delivered by a tube down his nose. On Friday last the nursing staff thought that the tube may have moved and asked for an x-ray to find out if it had.  
This was at 18:30 on Friday evening. I arrived at 10:00 on Saturday morning they were still waiting. I went to x-ray to find out why, and was asked what I wanted. I explained that my partner was being fed and given medication by the nose and that Parkinson medication cannot be stopped or delayed and that he had missed two coming up on three. Another person arrived and told me that this sort of x-ray does not take place at the weekend and that is the protocol.  
I contacted switchboard who put be through to the surgical bleep. This person could not have been more understanding and sorted matter with the x-ray department. Unfortunately the same happened 2 days later and again I had to contact the surgical bleep.May I say that when I was in x-ray I was standing in front of a poster stating that everyone should be treated with care, dignity and respect.Maybe a day on the wards would be good for x-ray staff?

author: violetyz35
title: Long wait for the family service
body:
I waited for weeks for a phone call from Inclusions family service about my daughter and despite contacting the service several times and being promised someone would be in contact it never happened. Now my daughter is no longer with us. I just wish there was a service on the Isle of Wight to support family members of addicts.  
Since it happened I met another person who had a very similar experience with the support from the family support group at inclusion, just very disappointed by my whole experience.

author: Sophia20
title: A broken ankle
body:
I fell over on my ankle in Spain and taken to hospital there, the worst experience of my life. I flew back to Scotland and attended Wishaw University Hospital and got the most amazing attention and operated on 2 days later by Miss McGlynn who did a first class job of fitting a plate and screws in my ankle. The nursing staff at the orthopaedic day surgery were unbelievable and I no longer have my fear of hospitals - Geraldine and Alicia, thank you!  
My out patient appointments are at Hairmyres Hospital where Claire, Carol, Gill have taken care of me and made me feel relaxed  
I’ve had a terrible fear of hospital all my life and hopefully my experience with these wonderful staff has cured that.  
Thank you again NHS

title: Excellent Experience
body: I've visited this practice a couple of times and recently had my first cervical screening. During the whole experience I was made to feel so comfortable, was talked through the whole process, and was still made to feel like more than a number to get in and out. This practice is an asset to the community and I feel so lucky to have this service.

title: Helpful staff
body: Great practice, helpful staff  and always willing to listen and advise, great with my children. Always try to do their best in challenging conditions - doctor will call you even if all face to face appointments have been taken.

title: Experience with Same Day Emergency Care Unit.
body: Reception and initial tests were faultless and speedy.. Staff were friendly and welcoming. Cup of tea and biscuits on arrival. Sandwiches for lunch.Very long wait (nearly four hours) for doctor, who was friendly and helpful on arrival, despite the pressure he was undoubtedly under. Scan and evaluation followed reasonably swiftly. Note was taken of my need to leave before dark. As a separate issue, I am disabled, and had to walk some distance, because the allocated disabled spaces near to the Unit were occupied by ambulances. I hope note will be taken of this.

author: SEand JAE
title: Calm and reassuring OT
body:
We received assistance (e.g. help with rails, shower seat, seat cushion, commode, rollator, plus exercises to help prevent falls) which was provided by an Occupational Therapist, Rebecca .  
I would like to give her A* for her work and commitment. She has a lovely, thoughtful personality and was able to build very good rapport with my husband (the client). She had a calm reassurance and was easy to talk to regarding the problems we faced.  
Thank you for providing a good service and enabling me to provide better care for my husband.

title: Great Practice
body: I have recently changed doctor from a surgery close by and so glad I have. Never felt more listened to than I have here. Always get straight to the point no messing you around. Thank you.

author: Cacu
title: Incredible Home Birth Team
body:
Southern Area Trust homebirth team were incredible during my pregnancy and postpartum. A nicer group of women you couldn't meet. They are so genuinely invested in your care and wellbeing, I was thrilled to see them coming for my antenatal appointments. They listened to my birth plan, answered many many of my questions, and equipped me with knowledge of what to expect and how to manage potentially arising issues. One massive plus for me was the continuity of care received from this small team - I met and knew all the midwives, so I felt comfortable with them and trusted them, which I felt would be very beneficial for the labour and birthing process.  
Unfortunately due to unforeseen circumstances, I couldn't have my baby at home in the end. However, the homebirth team attended to me during early labour, and provided my aftercare. After a very traumatic hospital birth, I was really struggling to sleep and come to terms with what had happened, and the home birth team were a complete lifeline. They are one of the main reasons that I have been able to move on from the birth, recover physically and mentally, and focus on being the best mummy I can be. They were also an incredible support in establishing breastfeeding.  
I honestly can't say enough good about this team and all they have done for our wee family. They hold a very special place in our hearts.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: suwyn
title: outpatient appt
body:
I had an outpatient appointment to see an orthopaedic doctor. I felt that they were very ignorant, did not introduce themsleves so I dont know their name, barely looked up, made almost no eye contact with me, made some very snotty remarks, one being, after I said I was struggling to do my work, they just shook their head, tutted, and said, maybe I should consider a career change, I am mid 60ies, doubt there is a queue of companies racing to employ a cripple, I really felt they were just horrible to me. They showed no empathy, despite the fact because of my bad hip I had fallen and my arm was broken both bones and set in plaster at lincoln hospital in october  
I came out of there shaking, crying, my friend who had driven me there took me for a coffee to calm down.  
sadly I have found that consultants often think they are a superior and this one wasn't the first one to be rude to me, I have a few horrible conditions, so being treated kindly would be a bonus,  
I dont think its too much to ask to be spoken to like a human being

title: First class servicr
body:
Having spent 16 days in hospital over Christmas and new year in the CCU ward and Medical Assessment Wards I would personally like to thank all of the staff from the cleaners, nurses and support staff right through to the consultants for their 1st class service.
Absolutely fantastic service including the hospitals phone call the following day to check on me.
If I had gone private I doubt that I would have had better service.
The meals I received were all first class with no complaints.
I feel you all deserve a huge thank you from the bottom of my heart.
Best regards and thank you
Paul Betts

readBy.name: Sarah Champion's Office, MP for Rotherham

author: happy dentist
title: Highly efficient and skilled NHS Scotland
body:
Just after Christmas a porcelain handle of a knife collapsed deeply into my right middle finger while cutting cake - a bit of a freak accident. I live in Dundee but was in Edinburgh at the time.  
I went to the Emergency Department at the Edinburgh Royal Infirmary and was redirected to minor injuries. I was seen within minutes by Leanne, a nurse practitioner. The wound was washed out with entonox for pain control, radiographs taken, antibiotics given, confirmation that a tetanus was not required, dressing placed and referral to the plastics unit at Ninewells Hospital.  
A call was received from an StR Plastics within the next hour asking me to attend area 3A at 08:00 the next morning in Dundee. I did and further radiographs were taken. I was admitted, surgery was carried out for nerve repair, porcelain fragment removal and sutures to repair the wound (under LA) - StR Hilder.  
I was discharged by 2:30pm the next day (under 24 hours). The whole team were excellent both within NHS Lothian and NHS Tayside - the receptionists, nurses, radiographers, porters, theatre staff and of course the surgeon. All were a credit to the NHS displaying all the values expected to a high level. THANK YOU.

author: Walker247
title: Swift treatment
body:
I visited a pharmacist for advice about a sore foot I had had for a couple of months, who advised me to contact my GP. A week later, having had a couple of unsatisfactory conversations with GP staff, I was advised to self-refer to the Podiatry department.  
My reception there was far more encouraging. I first spoke to Tracy, who ascertained that I was in pain and my mobility was adversely affected. She called in Ellen, the podiatrist, who deemed my situation worthy of immediate attention. She skilfully and painlessly removed dead skin, finding a hole and an abscess, which she applied a poultice to and dressed.  
My frame of mind was dramatically improved by pleasant staff, happy to treat my problem, having spent a week being told to go away in a variety of different ways. Thank you, Tracy and Ellen!

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: telescopiumfb64
title: Good community support
body: After falling and really struggling getting out of my chair my dad's doctor recommended the team coming to see. Joanna came to visit my dad and the service and what she recommended was really good. All the recommendations have been put in place and dad is slowly feeling the benefits.

author: Tersg66
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: A great stay in Female Surgical
body:
I’ve been in from Friday. I came up from A&E. My doctor had referred me up to ED, so I really didn’t have too long to wait thankfully.  
My stay on the ward has been very good. Everyone has been so kind to me. Very helpful nurses and nursing assistants. They are amazing. Eve, Bernie and Siobhan have been brilliant.  
The doctors have been so helpful. Being very thorough.  
The food is very good. Very tasty. I don’t know how anyone could say anything bad about the food in Daisy Hill, anything I have had to eat has been delicious.  
The ward is great. Lovely and clean. There is always someone in cleaning about.  
My only complaint would be that I don’t agree with the mixed wards. I think it was better when it was separate. I personally find it very uncomfortable.  
But other than that, my experience has been rather good here in Female Surgical.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Tersg66
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Daisy Hill Hotel
body:
My experience has been a very positive one. I’ve been extremely well cared for here in Daisy Hill. I honestly can’t wrap my head around how anyone can say one negative thing about our hospital. Newry would be lost without this place. We don’t realise how fortunate we are to have it. The staff working in this hospital are just angels! I’ve met some lovely people during my stay.  
The nurses become friends. Such helpful girls. It’s a home from home experience.  
The food has been very good. The porridge is beautiful. I look forward to breakfast every morning.  
It’s great the cleaning staff come round with fresh bedding.  
It’s like a hotel.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: encryptiongn58
title: Absolutely wonderful service!
body:
I slopped on ice and fell on Tuesday and went to walk-in centre , minor injuries, on Wednesday. I met 5 members of staff who dealt with me efficiently, sympathetically, x-rayed me, found I had broken my humerus, fitted a sling and released me with pain killing advice and an onward referral.  
Absolutely wonderful service! Thank you.

author: Tersg66
title: Staff are always happy. It's refreshing.
body:
It’s been very pleasant. I’ve had a good stay.  
The nurses are incredible. The long hours they do and yet they always seem to still have smiles on their faces. It’s very refreshing. I’m not the best of sleepers but the night staff come round and offer me a cup of tea and slice of toast. It’s the little details. They are very considerate and compassionate.  
The doctors are brilliant. I have been included in every step of my care. Answering any questions I have, no matter how silly they may seem.  
The food is nice. It is as a good as a restaurant if you ask me.  
My only complaint is that the ward can be a little chilly at night. I’m well wrapped up in my dressing gown but just feel a slight draft.  
Otherwise everything has been very good.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: corridorbm54
title: Everything has been absolutely fantastic.
body:
I came in Monday morning for an induction. The antenatal care I received was absolutely fantastic. The girls in delivery suite are amazing. Erica and Margaret kept me together. They were just brilliant. So supportive and encouraging.  
The ward is great. It’s spotless. It’s warm. Everything you could want.  
The midwives and nursing assistants on the ward are wonderful. So helpful. Nothing is a bother.  
The food is surprisingly good for hospital food.  
I’m a Midwife so I know what to expect but even I can say everything has been absolutely fantastic.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Kenedgey
title: Poor service after waiting 6 months to see the surgeon
body:
I was due to have a face-to-face appointment, but this was changed to a telephone assessment 6 hour before my appointment.  
The surgeon agreed I needed surgery, but needs to see me to asses me first. So changing my appointment to a telephone assessment has now added 3 months' extra wait before I'm even considered for surgery. It's not good enough, when I've already been suffering 12 months of continuous pain.  
I don't see the point of changing me to a telephone assessment when I have already had an ultrasound to confirm my problem to be resolved, and have waited 6 months to even get an appointment to see the surgeon after being referred.

author: Thankful84
title: The staff couldn’t have been more helpful.
body: My child was assessed, bloods taken and she was treated. My child received excellent care from Dr Johnston and the team. All the nurses were fabulous and took great care of my daughter. The staff were kind, considerate, knowledgeable and professional. I had complete faith in their ability to treat my child and ensure she was alright. Each step was explained to me and the staff couldn’t have been more helpful.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Rooju76
title: Exemplary care and professionalism
body: After injuring my knee, I attended FV Emergency Department. Despite the significant pressure the service was under, I was seen, treated and discharged within a few hrs. Thanks to Lorna, ENP, for her exemplary care and professionalism.

title: Recovering from covid
body:
I visited Derriford Hopsital following me continuously being unwell and being worried about a new symptom that occurred before the Christmas break. I was advised by a nurse who took a test for diagnosis that I had covid; I was advised to go home, rest and avoid contact with others for the next 5 days. 
The doctors and staff members at the Beaumont Villa doctors surgery were supportive, empathetic and very helpful ensuring that I had time off to recover. Thank you very much for your help! I truly appreciated it!!

title: Horrendous
body: Told l need urgent scan on 29th Dec 2022 for surgery 9th Jan 2023  waited for appt never heard anything so l started ringing on 3rd Jan 2023 12 times l rang but told they would be in touch   so by 4th Jan 2023 14.00pm still not heard so again rang explained situation re only Thursday 5th left for scan due to self isolation for covid before surgery date then they started ringing me of course no appt for Pembury  but told via my voicemail l had to co operate with them and go to Maidstone at 17 30pm 5th this would cost me nearly £200 for taxi

title: Disgraceful
body: After begging for an appointment for 2 days i got an email to say i have antibiotics waiting at the chemists. I have informed them i have some injuries due to a fall which havent been seen too now my cut has got infected how they cam still practice is beyond me

readBy.name: Wrightington, Wigan and Leigh NHS Trust

title: Do not recommend!
body: Absolutely horrendous practice and borderline impossible to get an appointment. On multiple occasions I have attempted to ring the practice at 8am - the automated message states that the phone lines are full to capacity and I cannot even join the queue to wait on hold? Everyone is being told to phone at the same time every morning - surely there must be a better way to resolve this? It takes over an hour to even join the queue, then to be finally able to join you have to wait another hour or so only to be told all the appointments have gone? It is an absolute joke! I have also attempted to book an appointment on the Nhs app countless times and also tried the link given to me by one of the receptionist (Ttp online service) with no luck either! I have 2 small children and it is not ideal for me to wait in a walk in centre for hours on end. Today I was not able to reach the practice via telephone for my 3 year old daughter and consequently had to send my husband to physically attend the practice and urge for an appointment. I called the practice 108 times in total. Beyond ridiculous. I have also recently discovered that the doctor is not in on Wednesdays and on Thursdays the surgery closes early - how on earth are people meant to be seen? It is outright disgraceful. Simply not good enough and the worst gp practice I have ever encountered. Please save yourself the hassle and find a different surgery if you’re considering registering.

title: Good service
body: Any time the practice contacts me - eg for a blood test or medication review etc , the practice does a fantastic job. However when I contact the practice for a GP appointment, the service is disappointing and I end up seeking medical assistance at A & E. Frustrating and been like this for some time.

title: Fantastic 1st class practice
body: We’ve been with these wonderful people for 40 years and they are all brilliant and I’m not just referring to the medical staff, I also include the reception team, Boots pharmacy which is attached to the practice and the random medical support staff which are there occasionally in the week. There’s nothing they won’t do for you, they go above and beyond, always make you feel relaxed and at ease, everything is followed up and chased up with either texts, emails, phone calls or video calls until the problem/challenge is resolved. Can’t say thank you enough to these top notch people. Totally recommended.

title: Good Practice
body: I have been lucky enough to not had a problem with this practice, I usually get a phone appointment if needed which can be turned into a face to face if necessary, yea there are delays in answering the phone and getting appointments but that is the case everywhere, the staff are always friendly and helpful, the GPs and Nurse Practitioners are always very professional and always provide advice and guidance about concerns. Just one bit of feedback would be to take note of comments in the Econsult forms, I ask to be called between particular times due to work commitments but get called outside of that time, I appreciate they have to prioritise calls but if I am called twice outside of the time window I am able to take calls and I cannot answer my call it means I have to resubmit my econsult which is a pain.

title: Exemplary service
body: Concerned that my 10year old had fractured his wrist. We were prepared for a wait but needn’t have. Excellent service, everyone introduced themselves by name and role and everyone addressed my son directly. Prompt assessment, X-ray and review. Incredibly impressed. Well done team xx

title: Awful practice!
body: Tried for 1week to get an answer for my elderly mother. Actually got through twice today, first call on hold for 25 minutes, tried again an hour later got through but on hold for 30 minutes! Would of been quicker to of got in a car and driven there. This is the reason for hospitals being under pressure, Gp'sneed to up their game! Will actually drive there tomorrow to get an answer and to ask to see Practice Manager!

title: can never get an appointment
body:
I managed to get an appointment for my 5 year old via 111 as I can never seem to get through on the phone at this surgery despite calling before opening and pressing the automated service to go through to the emergency appointment line and waiting in a queue. 
The doctor was very good and pleasant. I do not have any issues with the doctors at this surgery as they have always been very good when you get to see them but there never seems to be any appointments available even when calling for an emergency. When I call and lucky to get through I get told to call back in the afternoon which I do, nothing. It seems now I have to resort to calling 111 just to speak with a doctor on the phone or go to a walk in clinic which is just outrageous

title: Is the patient the Problem
body:
Pop Generally prompt  and efficient treatment following multiple visits after a difficult start trying to secure appointments for post operative care. This was only achieved after intervention by Corby Urgent Care Centre and a surgeon at Kettering General Hospital following a visit to A & E.
Also I am incensed by the text sent to tell me that if I am 3 minutes late I will risk losing my appointment slot. In all the appointments I have had recently I have always been on time. But I have had to wait for between 5 and 20 minutes to be called????
 Rules and regulations it seems count for more than patient care. Despite the difficult conditions faced by the NHS and GP practices which we all understand and make allowances for, this kind of unhelpful management directive undoes all the good sentiment towards your service to the British public.

author: membergh95
title: My maternity and antenatal care was fabulous
body:
I had a baby boy in Ninewells hospital in December 22. My maternity and antenatal care was fabulous.  
I was admitted with hyperemesis and covid in June 2022. The GP trainee doctor I saw and the senior nurse who looked after me during the night were so lovely, kind and caring.  
The Lochee midwives in Dundee were fantastic. In particular Lorna and Donna who were both kind and caring and helped me deal with my anxieties around pregnancy after a tragic experience a friend had.  
I went up to maternity triage a couple of times and on both occasions saw Rachel who was also fabulous and put me at ease.  
Lorna explained to me the different birth options which greatly helped me make an informed decision when I was really unsure what to do. We decided on a c section. I couldn’t fault the care. The anaesthetist, Andrew, is the best doctor I have ever seen. He kept us calm and explained everything so well and made the whole experience a positive one. The midwife Logan was superb as were the obstetricians Dr Orr and Dr Suttie.  
I went to a couple of antenatal classes in Dundee. The online one felt distant but the face to face one was superb. It was particularly good due to the small numbers and the encouragement by the midwife, Abbie, to make a WhatsApp group. This was life changing for me as to regularly meet these girls for a coffee settled my anxiety no end.  
Thank you all for such a positive experience.

title: Excellent care
body: In mid-December 2022 my son had a partial thyroidectomy to remove a tumour. From pre-surgery consultations and checks through to post-surgery treatment on ward and the post surgery appointment the staff have shown dedication and professionalism. They helped him through a stressful and painful experience. I am very grateful to Kingston Hospital and the National Health Service!

author: nuthatchsc66
title: Fantastic Nursing Service
body:
Following an incident which left me with multiple burns while recovering from surgery, I was referred to Gilford District Nursing Team.  
Since their first visit they were friendly, professional and inventive in their approach to dealing with the difficult to dress burns. They were responsive to my changing mobility issues and listened to me and how I was feeling.  
Each of the nurses and the student nurse who visited could not have been nicer. Their warmth and friendliness made a difficult time a lot easier.  
I cannot thank them or praise them enough. Excellent service and very much appreciated.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Not good on this occation
body:
Went to Wessex St Eye specialist for a cateract on Tuesday.

Whilst there the took my book pressure and it was way too high and told me to go straight to the doctors for another pressure test and consultation.

I went straight to the doctors and explained the seriousness of the situation that Wessex St stated I must go straight away.

The young lady went away to talk to somebody and after looking on screen said an appointment cannot be made until 1415 on Monday the 9th.

Just hope this will be OK as they were so insistent I sore a Doctorp/nurse straight away.

title: Staff went above and beyond
body: I attended the George Eliot Hospital for an appointment for blood tests re my high blood pressure. The staff were all extremely kind and supportive and went above and beyond. I was seen bang on my appointment time and can’t thank all the staff enough.

author: Betty76
title: Incredible nursing team
body:
I was very nervous about this procedure, I had done research and I knew it was not going to be easy. The incredible nursing team that supported me from the moment I walked into the waiting area were absolutely wonderful.  
Helena, Liz, Carol and Sue took time to get to know me as a person, they were all so kind, compassionate and friendly. Totally put me at ease. They made me comfortable held my hand throughout the tough bits and did not leave my side. They also spent time with me afterwards talking through my worries and really helped me more than they will ever know.  
An absolute credit to the NHS and to every patient who is fortunate enough to be in their care.  
Big hugs to the amazing nurses xxxxx

title: Shocking service over bank holiday
body:
I was referred with an appointment from 111 with severe chest infection, had waited many hours for call back and then more hours before I attended my appointment, on arrival I was told it was at least a five hour wait, even though I’d been waiting at home for over 9 hours, the receptionist was very polite but re-iterated that the wait was at least five hours and that they closed at 8pm in which case I’d have to go to a and e, all I needed was antibiotics as I didn’t want to be in hospital with pneumonia! 
The service, kindness and general set up was shocking and I heard the nurse saying that people should not stay and go to a and e, to the point I felt that if they were to focus on seeing patients rather than focus on getting rid of people the situation may have been better, the time to process patients seemed laboured and not time effective, in fact the down time between each triage seemed to be a very long time. I waited for while and decided that I could not face waiting all this time in an uncomfortable place for hours on end. I explained quietly to the receptionist and told her that I could not face waiting with no guarantee of being seen, I had done the right thing but ended up with no antibiotics , I am still unwell, two days later, no help, I was shocked at the lack of organisation and lack of planning with medical staff focusing on areas quite obviously being managed by the very nice receptionist. Who was fielding all the difficult questions. Very unhappy with the service we pay for, I would also like to say that whilst there are issues with the nhs, being grumpy with patients is a personal choice and not the fault of the government!

title: Downhill Stretch
body: Stayed after the mass resignation as I dont use doctors much until now. In December I had a Heart attack and heart surgery, when discharged I had a leter containing the medication I need to be on for life. 2 weeks later I find the surgery have lost the letter and no knowledge of my medication , asking who I gave it to and am I sure i delivered it whilst whingeing to other staff about a lost Samsung receipt, such professionalism. Knowing the whole staff and their shift patterns was not in the sign on forms i’m afraid, so do I trust them anymore or move practices? This has me worried at a time i’m supposed to avoid stress.

title: Distressing experience
body: My very Ill father was sent to hospital in an ambulance as medically expected.  He waited 28 hours in a dirty portacabin with no food.  After complaining numerous times to extremely rude nurses through the night we were sent to see a sister the next morning who was horrified by our experience.  We saw somebody superior who apologised but could not help us.  The nurses I have had experience with had made me accept the nhs is broken.  My experience has not seen overworked staff just inefficiency and totally unacceptable service

readBy.name: Mid and South Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Professional, caring, efficient
body:
Following a blue light ambulance ride to hospital where my details were radioed ahead, I was out the ambulance and in the resuscitation unit in seconds.  Greeted by a Stroke Nurse and a stroke Doctor, I was immediately assessed and prepared in a professional, reassuring and efficient way.  I cannot comment on the clinical/medicinal side as I am not qualified, but as a patient, I was made to feel confident in those around me and totally at ease with the treatment I was recovering, a scan and further treatment before being taken to a ward, was efficient, and seemly seamless. Yes there was a small wait for bed and then transport to it, but hey, I was informed of everything and was made to feel relaxed about the whole thing.  The ward continued in the same vein, two nurses at any one time,  who would have done anything for me if I'd asked, I had food, water and was checked constantly.  A follow up scan the next day, visits by other Stroke Doctors, a physiotherapist who I want my granddaughter to emulate when she gets older, because she was so thorough but calming and reassuring at the same time.  Everyone, form the guy cleaning the bed and area before I could get in, it all the way up to the stroke Doctors and nurses, I cannot praise highly enough.  

If I was to have one criticism, it would be a lack of info when I was discharged, yes I had been given a stroke association pack, yes I had discharge papers and medicines, but what I would have liked, was five minutes with a Stroke Doctor or Nurse for last discharge advice, like, "stay off work for two weeks", "don't drink alcohol" or "try and sleep more than usual" or whatever might be relevant, even an A4 piece of paper with that information would have been welcomed, but maybe everyone is so different that's not possible, and if the stroke doctors and nurses are busy saving other people, then I get it.
All in all, what a fantastic set of work colleagues.

title: Fantastic service
body: E consult at 08.30, GP thorough phone consultation at 10am and picked up prescription later that day. Faster than an appointment and so relieved to be able to start medication immediately. Many thanks to all.

title: Excellent service if difficult circumstances
body: I phoned 111 from a location near to this service on Tuesday 20 December around 10:00 am at a time when the system was under huge pressure to report breathing difficulties related to COVID and a very sore throat. A doctor phoned me back around 8pm and asked a succession of highly relevant questions, gave reassurance and made some very sensible suggestions as well as issuing a prescription directly to my chosen pharmacy. I felt that I was treated as an individual and that I received some very helpful advice. Thank you

readBy.name: North West Ambulance Service NHS Trust

title: Really good practise
body: I have always found all the staff to be extremely kind and helpful. Today, as an example, I rang at 8am after feeling extremely ill. I had to wait about 20 minutes but the receptionist was friendly and apologetic. I was seen at 8.50 and had the meds I needed by 9.10. I was so grateful and feel considerably better already. The hardest thing is getting through, but in the current climate I think this surgery tries extremely hard to accommodate their patient's needs. It's not perfect, but more a sign of recent times than a failing of the surgery or staff. I feel they care for my health and wellbeing as well as they are able to. They have never let me down when I've needed their help and always made sure they keep me informed about vaccinations/health checks etc I am eligible for. They make sure they support my changing health needs as I get older. Extremely satisfied, thank you.
